subtitles_text: >> JEFF PROBST: Previously on
Survivor: Deep in the heart of Africa, two
tribes have been battling. Nobody on the Fang goal!
How does that happen? Kota, the yellow tribe, has won
six out of eight challenges and lives very well.
>> Life is good. >> The rich are definitely
getting richer here at Kota. >> PROBST: Fang, the red tribe,
has struggled with everything, and squandered most of their
food. >> It's the Goof Troop.
It's ridiculous. >> PROBST: At Fang, Ace and
Sugar were tight with each other and no one else.
And Sugar had the hidden immunity idol.
>> I trust you. >> PROBST: So when the rest of
Fang discovered the idol, they agreed that Sugar and Ace were
the next to go. >> See ya, beeyotch.
>> PROBST: The two outsiders got a temporary reprieve when GC
got tired of the game and said he couldn't go on.
>> He came up to me and said that he's just done with this.
He's had enough. >> PROBST: The tribe saw his
weakness and voted him out. GC, the tribe has spoken.
Can Fang turn it around? And can Ace and Sugar survive
another Tribal Council? 13 are left.
Who will be voted out tonight? (metal striking repeatedly)
>> Nice! >> Yay, Matty!
>> Ah, I'm so happy. >> Oh, yeah.
>> It's just, like, positive energy now; we're all positive.
Nobody is dragging. >> You know, tonight was
particularly hard. >> Yeah, tonight was hard.
>> Tribal Council is sad. You know, not unexpected.
Um... GC had to go. I've got Sugar in my pocket, and
I need to try and arrange something that I can save myself
until merge. I just don't know who would be
my potential Benedict Arnold. >> (sings indistinctly)
>> Good morning. >> How'd you sleep?
>> Not very good. I was, like, up all night.
>> That's crazy, dude. >> I know what means the most to
me in my life. Every night I dream about food,
my dog, and my girlfriend. Every night.
This is by far the hardest thing I've ever done.
But... my whole driving force out here is Jamie-- she's my
girlfriend-- so I'm trying to make some sort of ring-type
thing. It's just something to keep
myself reminded of her. Because of her, I want to finish
this out to the end. I'm in a terrible position, and
I feel like I've been in a bad position the moment this game
started with Fang. If somebody approached me with
a legitimate, logical, reasonable plan that might
work, for sure I'm on board, man.
I am jumping on board and I'm flying with it.
\xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa Come over here.
What do you think? >> I'm just stressed, man.
>> Why? >> Man, I just want to make it
as far as possible, you know? >> You know, I just... I prefer
not to be blindsided. >> It all just depends on how
close everyone is, you know? I mean, you want to keep Kenny
around? Or Crystal, and all them?
>> Kenny. >> I mean, I-I don't really want
Sugar to go. You've got your Kenny, I've...
>> That's fine. Okay, that's cool.
That's the deal. >> Deal?
>> Deal. I got my Kenny, and you got your Sugar.
>> Until merge, you're... on your girl, you're not
gonna stab me in the back. >> Okay.
>> I'll... I can guarantee I'm with you.
>> Okay, what do you have to put it on, then?
>> My mother's life. >> Your mother's life that
you're gonna get me to... >> Yeah, same as your girl's.
>> Okay, I'll put it on my girl, then.
>> Okay? >> All right.
>> I mean, that's huge. My mother's my best friend.
>> My girl's my everything. I think Ace and I are probably
some of the top competitors out here physically, and I do like
him on my side, and... I made a pact with Ace that I can't
break, and I promised on my girlfriend, which is the love of
my life. She's my driving force out here,
and I'm not gonna break that promise for a million dollars.
Not for $5 million. (theme song playing)
Captioning sponsored by  CBS PARAMOUNT
NETWORK TELEVISION \xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa
\xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa (elephant trumpeting)
>> I know I look like Oliver, but... sorry.
>> What's on that menu? >> Don't drink, or drink at your
own risk. >> That's the sushi plate?
>> Randy. Are you gonna eat off this one?
>> Yeah. >> We might have to share
together, Bob. >> Yep. It works.
We've been eating very well, and when we got spices and salt, we
started eating quite a bit. But Dan was shoveling it on with
a spoon, and I realized when I served Susie and I, I put the
same number of scoops on my plate for Susie and I to share
as Dan put on for himself. >> It doesn't matter if you
weigh a hundred pounds more than me, you've still got the same,
like, proportion of food. But Dan's decided that he
deserves fourth and fifth servings of food.
(indistinct chatter) So now we are going through food
at an alarming rate, and he takes... multiple servings.
I'm sick about how much food is being wasted on him.
(frustrated grunt) \xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa
>> Well, what do you guys think? You think there's enough rice to
get through nine days? >> Here's the thing.
We could do two small. Say you want... or one big one
later? >> So whatever you guys think,
man. That's better for digestion:
we get two small meals. >> Cooking small, it's not that
good 'cause a lot of it sticks to the side.
>> I agree. >> Starting on day one, I was
talking about how everybody does not reserve the right to just
eating it raw and... and just spilling it all over the place,
and now, of course, we have a shortage of rice.
We have about six days' worth. If we don't have rice, we're
dead. Basically, we're gone.
It's hard for our tribe right now.
It's, like, we're at rock bottom.
>> Hello there. >> Hello.
>> Why? >> Yeah. Um...
Right? I was trying to hang on to my
idol as long as possible, but Ace came and told me that he
thinks they've gone through my bag and found it.
So I gave it to Ace for safekeeping.
Ace is now in possession of the idol.
He's got it in his pocket. I'm really putting a lot of
faith in Ace right now. Ace is kind of a snake, but he's
my snake, and I'm glad to have him.
>> It's been a crazy couple of days.
It went from me being in a position of no power to a
position of supremacy, having the immunity idol in my pocket.
I have Matty's word. I have Sugar.
I feel like I've put myself in a very good position, coming from
a tribe that I didn't have any alliance with.
And now suddenly, you know, I've got people there.
(elephant trumpets) Oh, my God, this is amazing.
I just turned around and there's an elephant swimming
through the water. Oh, how beautiful.
I guess that's one way to get from one side to the other.
(trumpeting) \xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa
>> PROBST: Come on in, guys! Kota getting your first look at
the new Fang tribe. >> (whispers): Jeez... God.
>> PROBST: GC voted out at the last Tribal Council.
All right, you guys ready to get to today's reward challenge?
>> Yeah. >> PROBST: For today's
challenge, each tribe will be tethered to a 20-foot-long,
200-pound snake. You will start on opposite sides
of the course. On my "go," you will race around
the course attempting to catch the other tribe.
If along the way you get tired and become a liability, you can
opt out of the challenge by simply disconnecting from the
snake. That will force the rest of your
tribe to pick up that extra weight.
First tribe to catch the other tribe and touch one tribe
member wins reward. Want to know what you're playing
for? >> Yes. Absolutely.
>> PROBST: I think you're gonna like it.
>> Oh! >> Oh, my God.
>> PROBST: Croissants, fruit tarts, chocolate \xc3\xa9clairs, plus
everything you need to make a nice cup of coffee... or a hot
pot of tea. In addition, the winning
tribe'll send one member of the losing tribe to Exile Island.
Worth playing for? >> Yeah. Yes.
>> PROBST: Kota, you have one extra member, sitting somebody
out, keeping in mind you cannot sit out the same person in
back-to-back challenges. >> I'll sit out.
>> PROBST: Corinne's gonna sit this one out.
Corinne, take a spot on the bench.
Everybody else, I'll give you a minute to strategize.
We'll get started. >> PROBST: Here we go.
For reward. Survivors ready?
Go! >> Come on, Kota.
>> PROBST: Huge reward on the line.
This challenge is going to be won by the tribe that wants it
the most. >> They're turning the corner.
They've got a few steps on us. >> We're gaining on them, guys.
Come on. >> Keep this pace.
Keep this pace. >> Take it easy.
>> Come on, Kota! You guys got this.
>> PROBST: Fang gets an early lead off the start.
>> We're all right. >> All right, downhill here.
Go. Let's go.
>> PROBST: Think about those pastries, that hot cup of
coffee. It would be nice to wake up to
some of that. >> Keep it up, Kelly.
>> PROBST: Kelly barely moving. >> Kelly, they're catching up.
>> I'm coming. >> PROBST: Kota now gaining on
Fang after one lap of this course.
You're going to get tired. You're going to want to quit.
Every time somebody drops out, you put a bigger burden on the
rest of your tribe. >> If you got to drop, drop.
Then we'll move. >> Kota gaining more ground on
Fang. >> All right, guys.
Here we go. >> Come on!
>> We've got to speed up. >> We got to move!
>> PROBST: Kota continues to make up ground.
>> We're gaining on them. >> PROBST: Fang is fading very
quickly. >> Drop half the people and we
sprint. Go. Just get off.
>> Okay. >> Sugar, go. Kenny, go.
>> Run! >> PROBST: Sugar and Kenny both
drop out, and that seems to help Fang.
>> Come on, guys. >> PROBST: They're now moving
much more quickly. >> Put 'em down right now.
>> Go, Kelly. Get out of here. Just unhook.
>> PROBST: Kelly has now dropped out.
>> Let's do this! >> PROBST: Fang is down to
three members. >> Come on, guys.
>> PROBST: Susie drops out for Kota.
Fang now getting some distance on Kota now that they've lost
Kenny and Sugar and Kelly. >> I'm getting tired.
>> PROBST: Crystal is starting to drag now.
>> They're dragging. Come on!
>> PROBST: Matty pushing her. Frustrated.
>> Crystal, just drop out if you can't do it!
>> PROBST: Crystal now drops out.
>> I can't take all that  weight, Matty.
>> Come on. Let's go! >> PROBST: It's all on Matty
and Ace. Big opening for Kota now.
>> Yeah, you've got this! >> PROBST: Kota with five
strong guys going up against Matty and Ace, who are
struggling. >> Come on the side of me!
Come on the side of me, man! (grunting)
Come on, grab it! >> PROBST: Matty carrying half
that snake himself. Ace dragging the other half.
Ace trying to keep his pants up! Kota closing in on a big win
and a huge reward. >> Yeah!
Yeah! Yeah!
>> PROBST: Kota wins reward. >> Yeah!
>> Not even close. Not even close.
Nice. >> You all right, Bob?
>> Oh, God. >> If I can do it at your age...
>> PROBST: Kota, congratulations.
This reward has enough for you to sample a little now and
still have plenty to take back to camp.
>> Can you share? >> Can we have one?
>> Uh, no. >> Everyone grab one of these.
>> Thank you, Jeff. >> Ooh, I want some
strawberries. >> Mmm!
>> Crystal, what hurts more, losing or seeing this tempting
array of food in front of you and knowing you can't have it?
>> Losing over and over. (sniffles)
It's starting to hurt. >> PROBST: Something you're not
used to. >> No.
>> Waah, waah, waah! >> PROBST: All right, Kota, who
are you going to send from Fang to Exile Island?
>> Sugar. >> PROBST: Sugar, for the
fourth time, you'll be sent to Exile Island.
Sugar, you will return in time for the next immunity challenge.
Fang, got nothing for you. Grab your stuff.
Head back to camp. >> I love winning challenges.
More importantly than winning challenges, I absolutely love
watching them lose. >> PROBST: Kota,
congratulations. Come get your reward.
>> Randy? To me, he's just... He's a troll.
He's a troll under the bridge that's just mean and angry with
the world. I don't play like that.
Do not disrespect me like that. I have a feeling that in the
event there's a merge, that old Fang and new Fang won't
get along.  >> No pun intended, but sweet.
>> Today's challenge just showed that Kota is a strong, unified
team. And I'm so excited to see that.
I mean, when it works like a charm in the challenges, there's
just no better feeling. >> I think we need a table to
sit down and have breakfast at. >> Has anyone thought about how
we want to split this up? >> Charlie had a great idea.
Split it up, and each individual person can just eat
their share as they want. >> Well, I know that, um, there
are definitely seven croissants and there's seven
of these jelly things. >> Okay.
>> And then we could figure out how many's in the middle.
>> So, if someone doesn't want an eclair, they can get an
extra one of these. If someone doesn't want
a Cinnabon, they can get one of those.
>> If it wasn't for Dan, we wouldn't have rationing laws,
so when the pastries came back, like, the old Kota
members like me, Marcus, and Charlie are already like, "How
are we going to divide this?" So we tried to make it as fair
as possible. >> This will be...
>> This should just be gravy. >> What do you mean gravy?
>> Extra. Go with the original plan, which
was cook dinner and, um, you know, this is just...
>> Yeah, 'cause that will give us one more meal on the back
end. >> Exactly.
>> That's why it's a good idea. >> I don't want to be hungry
come midnight. >> Dan, he has annoyed
everybody. He's even annoyed me a little
bit. >> This is so good.
I can't stop. >> Yeah, it does.
It feels so good when it hits my lips.
>> My best move might be to just kind of slowly distance
myself from Dan as I bring myself closer to the original
Kota. >> God, those pastries are good.
>> Go for it. >> If I take one bite, I only
have one and a half left. >> It's a reward.
There's no rationing. >> Don't do that.
>> I knew that they were probably going to send me back
to Exile. This is lame.
Why-why... Why do I get to come back here
and... Eat fruit when everybody is
starving at my tribe, and they're running out of food,
and they don't have anything but rice.
And I'm feeling really guilty. I just feel bad knowing that I
already have the idol. Actually, I gave Ace the idol in
case he needs it before Tribal, but...
Well, we'll see if that happens. >> I wouldn't mind getting some
more of the fruit. >> Hey, this is my opinion.
Today it's super mellow out. >> Re-hydrate.
>> Tomorrow we're going to have a big day, and it's probably
going to be super hot. So we might as well get
everything done today, get all the canteens filled.
>> I don't know why you're stressing over it.
>> I'm not stressing. >> Yes, you are.
>> Fang lost another challenge. We needed that food because
I'm, like, withering away, and we have, like, three scoops
of rice. And then, Crystal's reaction
of our loss was huge. She just, like, broke down in
tears. Personally, I just think her
personality sucks. >> I know.
Like, seriously, that all just, like, sucks.
It's like a damper on the team. Like, you don't need to cry,
right? >> Well, it's just a different
sort of cry than uh... Sugar's cry is more a...
>> Emotional. >> Emotional, I'm happy to be
here. >> Right.
>> Don't view my tears at today's challenge as a sign of
weakness. Because it's far from that.
You and Kelly view me as weak now because I was crying?
>> Not weak. >> Where did they go, up by the
hill or they went by tree mail? >> By tree mail and by the hill.
>> I hope that they don't put me in the same category as GC,
someone that wants to give up. Because shortly after I got
back to camp, I snapped out of my funk.
But Kelly hasn't had two words to say to me, and so now she's
going to feel the wrath of Crystal.
>> Hey, how did you get here? >> Same way you got here.
>> Really? >> She walked.
>> Are you feeling better? >> Yeah, I mean, y'all have
already had the comforts of food.
I mean, you guys have had fish. I've had a pinch of a freaking
sardine. You know what I'm saying?
>> Mm-hmm. >> But, like I tell you and like
I tell everybody else in my tribe: don't mistake my tears
as a sign of weakness because at some point, we all get
depressed. It's just that mine come out
through my eyes, you know. I mean, I think I can still
battle with the best of them and just don't mistake it as a
sign of weakness because it's not.
But I'm fine now. >> I definitely think that
Crystal crying in front of the Kota tribe and our tribe, it
shows a sign of weakness. Like, you could take it
either which way, you know. Like, she can explain it to us,
but she can't explain it to the Kota tribe.
>> I think more so with me, it wasn't the danish, it was the
pride. >> It just sucks,
especially when you lose, and we lose every time.
>> Marcus. A giant turtle.
>> A giant turtle? >> Not giant, but big enough.
>> Okay, hold on, hold on. Hold on.
Let me give you my shirt or something.
Untie me. I'll bring the boat around.
>> Your hands are too important. Hold on.
>> Listen to me. I don't want you to lose your
hand. >> It doesn't matter.
It's food. >> Whoo!
>> All right, we've got a turtle!
I was really excited because it was like winning a reward
challenge, except we did it ourselves, so it had that extra
bit of joy to it. >> That is neat.
>> You know... You know how to cook that,
right? >> That's good size.
>> Kill it and then crack the shell, break it out, and cut it
in cubes and boil it. >> Wow.
>> Go for it. I'm excited about it.
I think it's going to taste good.
Have you ever had gumbo turtle soup here in the jungles of
Africa? How cool is that?
>> It's going to be delish. I know it.
>> That's delicious. >> That is so good.
Mmm. >> I can't complain.
>> Right now, the Kota tribe is probably at our highest high.
The fact that we caught a turtle has just knocked us up
ten notches. Fang better watch out.
>> (muffled): I love it. >> PROBST: Come on in, guys.
We'll now bring in Sugar, returning from Exile Island.
>> Howdy. >> Hi.
>> PROBST: All right, you guys ready to get to today's
challenge? >> Yep.
>> PROBST: First things first. You're hiding it back there,
Charlie. Once again, immunity is back up
for grabs. For today's challenge, each
tribe will divide into three pairs.
Each pair will be tethered together by rope.
On my go, the first pair will crawl under a cargo net, race
into the jungle, navigate an obstacle and retrieve two
sections of a flagpole, then race back.
Then the next pair goes. Each leg of the challenge adds
another obstacle, making it more difficult.
First tribe to collect all three pairs of flagpole pieces
and assemble it correctly wins immunity.
Safe at least one more day in this game.
Losers, Tribal Council, somebody going home.
Make sense? >> Yes.
>> PROBST: Kota, you have one extra member.
You're going to have to sit somebody out.
Who's it going to be? Susie, you're going to sit this
one out? >> Yep.
>> PROBST: Take a spot on the bench.
Everybody else, I'll give you a minute to pair up, and we'll
get started. Here we go, for immunity.
Survivors ready? Go!
Bob and Randy for Kota and Kelly and Sugar for Fang.
>> Nice, Sugar, nice, Kelly! >> PROBST: Kelly and Sugar
getting through the course quickly.
Randy dragging it for Kota. Fang looking strong.
Sugar against Bob on the ropes. Who's going to have the most
nimble fingers, get that first flag sections?
Bob has their flagpole sections down.
Sugar has hers down! Got to unclip and get back.
Randy and Bob heading out. Kelly and Sugar right behind.
>> Let's go, guys. >> Come on. Hustle it out!
>> Halfway there, come on! >> Go, you got it!
>> PROBST: Bob and Randy are back through the crawl-through
first.  >> Come on! Come on!
>> PROBST: Let's go, girls! What are you doing?
Fang slowing down. >> Come on. You got it!
>> PROBST: Bob and Randy with a bit of a lead for Kota now.
>> Come on! Come on! >> Hustle! Go! Go!
>> PROBST: Gotta get back to the mat before the next pair can go.
Corinne and Charlie on the court.
Kelly and Sugar are losing a tremendous amount of time for
Fang. Kelly is dragging.
>> Nice! >> PROBST: Charlie and Corinne
through the crawl-through. Ace and Crystal out on the
course for Fang. >> Come on, baby!
>> PROBST: Kota now at the second obstacle.
Fang finishing up the first. >> Let's go.
>> PROBST: Charlie and Corinne make quick work of it.
Crystal and Ace trying to catch up.
>> Come on! Let's go.
Come on! >> PROBST: Corinne whipping
through the knots for Kota. >> Get out of the way.
>> PROBST: Corinne has the second set of flagpole pieces
released. Ace trying to pick it up for
Fang. Ace has them undone.
Got to unclip. >> Do it... oh, that hurt!
It's all right. >> PROBST: Charlie and Corinne
with a decent lead for Kota. >> Come on!
>> All right, guys! 20 yards!
>> PROBST: Charlie and Corinne moving through the crawl.
Ace and Crystal have made up a lot of time for Fang.
Fang gaining on Kota. That lead is evaporating now.
Corrine and Charlie are back. The final two for Kota.
It's Dan and Marcus. >> Go!
>> PROBST: Fang's back. The final two for Fang:
Matty and Kenny. Matty throwing himself.
Matty and Kenny quickly through the crawl-through.
>> Come on, buddy! Come on! You okay?
Come on. >> PROBST: Dan and Marcus at the
second obstacle for Kota. Matty and Kenny right on their
tail. Dan and Marcus now at the third
obstacle. Matty and Kenny right there.
They're going to pass Kota now, climbing over the obstacle.
Matty and Kenny have overtaken Marcus and Dan!
Fang now in the lead. Matty and Kenny unbelievable in
this leg. Kenny has the pieces to the
flagpole down. Dan has them down.
Matty and Kenny heading back with the final two pieces to
that flagpole. Dan and Marcus right behind.
They're going on top of the challenge.
Fang through first. Kota right behind.
>> Come on! Come on!
>> PROBST: Fang still with the lead on Kota.
We are neck and neck! Matty and Kenny made up a lot
of time. Got to get back to the mat.
Then you can start work working on the flagpole.
Get back, Kenny. You got to get back!
>> Get up! >> Come on, Kenny!
>> PROBST: Go! Gotta untie all six pieces
first. Then you start working
on assembling it. >> That's not it!
That's not it! >> PROBST: This is where
teamwork is going to win or lose this challenge.
Kota working together very well. >> Get out of the way!
>> PROBST: Ace not wanting help from anyone.
After coming so close, Fang now falling behind.
Ace trying to muscle it in. All the pieces will interlock.
You don't need to force anything.
Kota quickly working together on assembling their flagpole.
>> It's not going in! >> PROBST: Ace still struggling
to make sense of this. (cheering)
Kota wins immunity once again! >> Good job, guys!
>> Yes! >> Yes!
>> PROBST: Kota, once again, immunity is yours.
Kota, not much to say. You continue to dominate
in this game. Enjoy it.
Grab your stuff. Head back to camp.
>> Thanks, Jeff. >> PROBST: And Fang, once again,
Tribal Council, all yours. And if you continue to play
like individuals, you'll be there every time.
Tonight, one of the six of you going home.
You have the afternoon to figure out who it's going to be.
Grab your stuff. Head back to camp.
>> Ace is a tyrant and a bully and a lot of people see Ace as
a strong competitor, but he's been in our tribe for three or
four challenges now, and we haven't won anything.
So, how is he benefiting me? \xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa
>> The challenge was challenging.
There were a couple of people that died right at the end.
I was expecting more from Kelly, and she really just sort
of petered out. She goes, it strengthens the
team, and I think she's just irritating and really dumb.
Kelly's going home tonight. It would be stupid not to send
her. >> All right, don't get mad at
me when I say this, but, uh, if we, if we merge at nine...
>> Yeah. >> And we go into the last
three ,and it's going to be you, Sugar or me, she can play the
idol and I can leave, dude. I think we should flush the
idol tonight. You and I and her, that's too
much of a risk. Why can't we play it tonight?
>> Matty, look at me. She can't play the idol.
Trust me. >> If it's us three...
>> Trust me. >> Okay, all right, I trust
you then. >> Matty wanted to get the idol
out and I just tried to convey to him that he doesn't really
have to worry about that to that extent because although I don't
want to tell him I have the idol; obviously, I do.
Man, don't worry about the idol. I promise we'll take care of it.
>> All right. Kelly, then.
>> Kelly. >> Okay.
>> The alliance is sound. I would hope to trust Matty.
Sugar I pretty much trust completely.
I don't see any reason why Kenny would not go with what it
is, and I think it makes sense for everyone to get rid of
Kelly. >> Why not?
>> Because it's not going to work.
That's what I tried to run by Ace right when I got here.
>> Why do you trust Ace? >> Who said I did?
>> Well, then, when you went to talk to him in the woods, what
did you ask him? What did he say?
>> He said, "Kelly." "Kelly."
I said, "I guess. That sound good to me, dude."
>> I really want Ace out of here.
>> We can't vote Ace off. We have to win a freaking
immunity... >> Have you won one yet since
he's been here? Okay.
>> I don't know what's going through Matty's head.
He's running and telling Ace everything and Ace ain't
running and telling him anything.
>> Let's just get out Kelly. I don't know why we have to
get... Let's just start with this.
>> Okay. I'm still very leery of Ace and
Sugar because they are in an alliance, and Kenny, myself,
and Matty, we have to be leery of everything that's going on
around us. >> Something is up tonight.
>> Matty... >> No, no.
>> He's just riding the fence. >> Right now, the safest best is
to write down Kelly. >> Ace is probably writing down
Kelly. Sugar is writing down Kelly.
>> Matty is writing down Kelly. >> Matty is writing down Kelly.
Right now, I'm really torn 'cause I really want Ace out of
here. >> Do we trust Ace or Kelly?
I don't trust Ace. >> I don't trust Ace.
>> Crystal knows something's up, and she does not trust Matty.
Crystal is on to something. Right now, know what Crystal
told me? She told me that, "Yeah, I'm
worried about Matty, that he's flipping."
And I'm like, "Don't worry. We're sticking together."
Crystal said, "Okay." >> All that we have to know is
that Kelly goes next. That's it.
That's all we have to know right now.
>> Or blindside Ace. >> I can't.
I made a promise that I can't break.
>> Yeah, but, man, you can't trust someone like that when
they say they have an agreement. >> We made a serious agreement.
